qK1D_4m_-3LayVE0uMldQA.text: pretty good but nothing special.Location:There was around a 20 minute wait at 1310 on a Saturday. The restaurant has that industrial chic look with a slight 'farmhouse' twist (my friend described it that way. It's hard to elaborate but it really does fit). The booths upstairs are pretty comfy though the cushion stops at shoulder height sadly.Toilets here bear a striking resemblance to caravan. Again, they have that slightly farmhousey vibe in keeping with the rest of the restaurant but are also unisex and also, like caravan, feature exfoliating aesop hand wash.Food:Perhaps I should have just stuck to the baked eggs as recommended, but instead we ordered an omelette and an eggs benedict. Both were good but nothing to shout about. We also ordered fries served with Aioli (the Aioli was really nice), and a side of herbed avocado.Assuming you like avocado, order it as a side regardless of what you get. It was the one standout item by far.I personally had a banana milkshake which I loved as well. Particularly as the portion was very generous. Slightly less thick than most milkshakes which some people might take grievance with but I didn't mind.Overall:I really enjoyed it but I think workshop which is similar, and just down the road, is notably better for food. That being said, I'll have to return to try the baked eggs at some point.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Toasted ciabatta with rucola, dried tomatoes and herbed avocado
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Omelette
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict

HyRqKT-zv4Cd39u8uc-OtQ.text: We had a nice brunch here, and it's a great place to be able to sit and watch. Watch the coffee being brewed and your food being cooked, and then you get to eat it. I was slightly disappointed that the fryer was broken, so I ended up with the eggs benedict on pretty standard by nicely crisped rye bread. It was tasty to the point I didn't mind at all.

QGB_X7AngoeIzk_Gn1kY2Q.text: Ozone are coffee roasters but also happen to have a restaurant and in the basement they have a full sized coffee roaster too! I'm always on the look out for great breakfast spots as I'm a bit of a skylark and I always wake up hungry! A lot of places that do a breakfast menu tend to offer standard breakfast options. So I really love it when there's a bit of a twist, great example would be places like Dishoom's Bacon & Egg Naans (you're missing out if you haven't had one yet!).Though this isn't at all earth shattering, it's at least different! The menu is seasonal, so we got the Autumn menu. Eggs Benedict minus the boring bland English Muffins, replaced with bubble & squeak... yummy! The sweet potato rosti is quite a large plate but the mixture of the flavours were just perfect and really does full you up for hours on end! They have seating around the kitchen which let's you keep an eye on the chefs as they prepare the food. Overall, a nice little restaurant for a small group of friends or on your own to get some alone time (bar seats)... Like it!#greedymoo #londonfoodie #foodporn #breakfast

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Bar seats
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Black Americano

Z3YXJgFocyikQzjFBwdVwQ.text: Just outstanding.  Super comfortable space that felt like I was back home in Seattle.  Some of the best coffee I have ever had and everyone's breakfast was delicious.

xbxdlR2VQGcLYNzQE__-Aw.text: Came here for a relaxing coffee and cake. Place is too stiff and uptight !!Asked for a takeaway coffee and pastry and then saw some nice empty benches to sit on so asked if I could sit. Wow!! This was a problem!!! I was told I could not sit on benches ( counted 5-6 spots free) and needed to ask hostess to seat me first. Basically lug my coffee and pastry and wait in a queue!!Finally told by another staff member I was permitted to sit in the empty space available. Phew!!! thanks!! After this staff basically ignored me and were difficult with any further orders I made .

QFGLG9OEwvZn43d-S4zCpQ.text: On food and drink alone, I would have rated Ozone higher - the coffee and omelette with eggplant, cauliflower and capers was stunning. However, the service here is so subpar that I'm not sure I would return. Though there was a line out the door, I was seated quickly at the bar as a party of 1. Immediately (and I mean immediately), a server was at my side requesting my order - I literally hadn't gotten to reading the second item on the menu. Seemingly as punishment, the staff was wholly inattentive the remainder of my meal. I certainly understand they were very busy that morning, but they didn't seem particularly short staffed, simply mediocre. Once my meal was finally delivered, I was not checked on again until 15 minutes after I had finished my meal and pushed my plate to the side for removal. In all, my breakfast for one took about an hour and 20 minutes from start to finish. Would seem the line wouldn't be so long if you could turn your seats over faster than that. If you have loads of time to waste, by all means try it out. The omelette was one of the best I've had. I would recommend skipping the bacon, though - it was very fatty and tasted only like the oil it was drenched in.

3nnnyzKmxB9CYMsILsJnvQ.text: A nice trendy coffee shop, full of people just catching up for breakfast, having work meetings or just enjoying the coffee.The coffee is very good. I ordered a Mocha, and they were aware their coffee is what everyone wants, thus why it probably had the least chocolate of any Mocha I've ever ordered. Only when I got to the bottom, did I notice 3 tiny lumps of chocolate :/. However their chai tea latte, is possibly the best I've ever had. Spicy, without being overly "spice" tasting. It's just a shame it comes in such a small glass, you really need two to be satisfied, or have it with a coffee of course.The Smoked fish kedgeree looked amazing, but I went with ordinary eggs and sourdough bread. I couldn't complain, it was good, but wish it had been accompanied by a relish like the Tomato Kasundi at Workshop Coffee.The staff were great, considering as people continually joined our table, they had to keep getting menus and additional drink orders, but everything came and you leave with a smile on your face and the smell of warm roasting coffee lingering in your nostrils and your clothes.The coffee is apparently so good, they'll also roast beans to order for you right there. If you need to ask the price for such a service though, you'd better stick to the supermarket beans :D

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Chai Tea Latte
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Mocha
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs /w sourdough bread

39tGWKhciCz4jOjAgrwmDw.text: Cappuccino: The shot was really rich and nutty, but the milk was a bit airy. Overall, really great cap!

_y1gGI4kvC4Yi8gYrmTi6A.text: Beautiful space. Came in originally for just coffee takeaway but the menu enticed us to stay.There's the dreaded bench seating (see many of my other reviews) but there's actually plenty of other options. Dog friendly at least in that area, didn't ask if we could take him to a table more inside.A bit pricey for fancy pants mushrooms on toast but hey ho. It was delicious. I felt well posh.The coffee was tasty. It's a good sign when I do not feel the need to add sugar to my cup.Service was friendly but there was a strange mixup on toast. We ordered breakfast and halfway through realized that my friend's potted egg thing could do with some more bread. Ordered quickly after the realization but took a very long time to get said toast. Anywho. A bit pricey but would go again if in the neighborhood.

Jtbl9TrVtHa8NfSqk6Y8cg.text: Ozone Coffee - big fan!Last Saturday, famished wandering the London streets, trying to find somewhere to satisfy my hunger pangs when I stumble across this little gem.I was lucky enough that there wasn't a large queue an was seated within 5 minutes - yayy.Sat at the kitchen-bar area gave me a great glimpse into the guys making my eggs and i was particularly mesmerised by one tattoo'd guy scrambling eggs in about 30seconds over what seemed to be the world's hottest pan! On the plus side, I now know what kind of hob I want in my future kitchen!My eggs were delish as was the sourdough I had them on. My coffee was amazeballs and obviously my newfound coffee persistence is having an effect of (necessarily) decreasing my caffeine sensitive because I didn't have my usual jittery buzzingness afterwards!There was a bit of food-envy courtesy of the guy next to me who had the veggie breakfast but all-in-all, a great experience and wonderful food :)

7KWk9JupUQmfmpWyJYhGfg.text: Things really could not have worked out better on our first trip to Ozone.  We were met straight away by the friendly hostess/counter person/waitress who directed us to our seats.  She handed over the menus, informed us of two breakfast items that were no longer being served, adorned our counter top spot with tap water then left us to peruse the food selection.  Shortly thereafter, another nice, young woman came to take our drink order.  The flat whites, by most standards, came in record time!  Then, the original gal came back 'round to take our order.  We had a few menu questions which she deftly answered, and that was that.  Our food came out fairly quickly, too.  The hubs had a Benedict-the foundation of which was made up of bubble and squeak instead of an English muffin-and pronounced it some kind of superlatively tasty experience.  I ate both a gluten-free brownie (not terribly moist, but dense and chocolate-y) served with lovely whipped cream and half of the hub's grub.  So good.Ozone is an attractive breakfast/lunch spot that serves up some very good food.  I'm so very glad to have gone before the impending move to CH!

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. The best/worst breakfast ever.
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Killer brownie with a large dollop of whipped cream on the side.

yYwqf0kTdEIoW55ByMpXcA.text: Ozone's space immediately reminded me of Sightglass Coffee in SF, with an industrial feel, the roaster down below, and seating up above.  The coffee was on the same level, too.  In case you haven't been to Sightglass, this is a high compliment.  I didn't write down what my wife and I each had, but they were 2 distinct single origin varietals - probably Central American and African, if our usual preferences held. Several brewing methods are available; I had an Aeropress, she had pourover.  Both were truly excellent - certainly among the best coffees I've had in London and in the top 10 I've had anywhere.  The quality of the raw coffee they're using must be high, and the brews were richly flavored and neither over- nor under-extracted.   A few nitpicks keep them at 4 stars rather than 5: 1) My coffee was not hot when it arrived.  My wife's was.  We had them brewed in 2 different ways, but please either serve each as it is completed or time the brewing better.2) The filter coffee prices are pretty steep (£4+ if I recall correctly).  I'm happy to spend that much occasionally, since the coffee is really good, but it will keep them from being a regular haunt for me.3) I enjoy watching cooks in action as much as anyone, but to maximize the enjoyment of my coffee, I'd prefer if the kitchen was a little more enclosed or separated from the main seating area.  I'm fine with a coffee roastery smelling like roasting coffee (although it's more acrid than one might expect and always biases my palette in favor of lighter roasts while I'm there).  But having the place smell a bit like a diner throws me off when I'm paying £5 for a high end, delicately-flavored coffee.Still, clearly a great place for coffee, and impressive enough that I'll be bringing out-of-town guests to try it.

7ht8jqYTEgDx_yc5-QAcjg.text: Ozone is a diamond in the rough City. We shared their olives, broccoli bruschetta, baked artichokes and lamb for dinner tonight, followed by brioche pudding with baked peaches & walnut cream. We were absolutely impressed with the quality of the meal, attentive staff and tasty beer selection. This will now be one of our regular spots! A *must have* in the city, complimented by an atmosphere of hip groovy tunes and restored old wood throughout the build that doesn't feel in the least contrived, rather organically developed.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Booth comforts

4rQ-jl6JRYjjjFkKe4uQIA.text: Owww, fancy sancy pants! I haven't a dewberry* when it arrived on the scene but I sure am glad it did. Like I have previously gushed about, I do love excellence and the kids at Ozone are indeed rocking the suburbs!I could ramble on about what I think the're about, but I'll let the pro take the stage."Our vision is to consistently aspire to coffee excellence in all facets and achieve international recognition as a leading artisan coffee company. We do this by rewarding and inspiring our team, and implementing robust systems and processes that duly guarantee the ultimate coffee experience for all our clients. We're humble about our achievements but aspire to be the best.People are a vital part of our operation and our philosophy is to build strong relationships with our clients, suppliers and our team. We invite you to join us on our journey as we live, roast, tasteand talk coffee."Anybody else turned on? Mmmm, coffee and excellent and passionate people making coffee. Oh yeah giddy!* just spotted that they opened in March 2012

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

ETUYqxagpKcGDEfoj60YkA.text: You don't realise how bad other coffee chains are until you have coffee at a place like this. They have a table service and a bar style counter for a quick casual coffee. My friend had a cold drip and while I didn't try it, it did peak my curiosity. In fact I was told they don't serve you any caffeine after you are done with the cold drip. Me, I prefer a flat white (skinny) and I loved it.

jVvIDmUVwFlVA_ZLW17yYA.text: Had a great breakfast here. Nice omelet with just right moist insides and a great coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Omelet with a nice crust but still moist inside.

kYT67ZXVT8DKHbgMwtFluA.text: Hmmm. Was in the neighbourhood and can't pass up the opportunity to try "da Ozone". Hmmm.. Fair-to-middling is my vote. Sorry fan base. Here's how it went down : Walked in, ordered a coffee, paid, was offered a loyalty card, accepted the offer, got aforementioned clipped (whoop whoop, retro). Then stood around in the very crowded "bar" area.It's laptops everywhere, meetings going on, sightsee-ers, people eating big breakfasts, while on laptops, men with beards, the buzz, the relaxed beats, the roaster, and people having meetings over laptops. It took a little while - busy time, noon on a Thursday - and then I got handed a take out cup. Whoops! Didn't order coffee to go. So I asked for a "to-stay cup please?"Oh dear, there's a system. I didn't know about it. I'd done the usual : go in, order, pay, wait for coffee, find a seat. EXCEPT @Ozone you get a seat first! Next to the people with the laptops having a meeting. Ooohhhhhhh!Alright, I'm not in a hurry. I am now seated, uh oh, bit wobbly. I am brought a glass of water. Thank You!My latté comes. It's small. It's powerful. I like it. The laptop meeting people leave. That glass of water was a good call.A man with a beard and laptop is packing his up. There are more people waiting at the counter - with laptops. And beards. I'm reading my magazine. Old school. I think I'll be okay.Perhaps I should grow a beard?!

8tBEoUHyi61o6v3VY2x5vg.text: With the plethora of coffee houses that are now in the Shoreditch/Old Street area - you can't go wrong with most.  It also means every place really needs to pick up their game to stand out. If Ozone was anywhere else in London, I would probably give it a 4 star rating, though I have to admit that my go-to breakfast spot it just around the corner at Salvation Jane (now again know as Lantana) Likes: Breakfast - the eggs are a delight and if you're having breakfast have them with some smashed avocado.  Dislikes: After going a couple of times and finding that the cold drip was out for the day, I finally made it in to give it a try. Honestly, I don't know what all the rave was about - the coffee as Ozone is great, but not the cold trip.Service: Awesome. Here they know their coffee and if you're looking to try something different and are willing to experiment (and give some info on what you like and don't like) you can definitely walk away from here having tried something new.

Ca9KDiVIE60i6sayZKjXkg.text: Popped in here for some lunch after reading the reviews, nice place although had to wait a while before I eventually made eye contact with one of the servers, ordered the omelette as they were out of baked eggs, when I ordered the food it did arrive pretty quickly and was pretty good although £15 for an omelette and a breakfast tea seemed pretty steep.

zYSDT2uveGYpVQWOsKu2LQ.text: We got invited by friends to enjoy a brunch and coffee here. We had no idea what to expect but we clearly were not disappointed.The kind of industrial / run down atmosphere, with the kitchen in the middle of the place, and downstairs the place where they roast their own coffee, just gives a great feeling to the place.Either tables for 6 with benches like in a diner, or along the counter, or a few small tables.First of all, the coffee. I've now learned that New Zealanders roast great coffee :-)And for the eggs: excellent. I've had the eggs Benedict and I loved the way they put the eggs on a potato cake instead of bread. The other egg-based dishes also looked excellent.Staff is very nice and efficient.Amusing detail: a guy who arrived before us pretended to be us by citing our name which he saw on the reservation list... Staff managed to get us another table, and we greeted the guy by our name when we saw him ;-)

SA74zgcYbomPxhUn0KGVwA.text: Had a late brunch after church. Cappuccino was excellent; food was well-prepared and delicious. Place was a bit crowded and thus we had a slight wait and getting server's attention wasn't as easy as otherwise might be, but all in all it was a nice experience with tasty food and great coffee. My eggs benedict was good, though the polenta was slightly over-cooked; wife's "big brekkie" was outstanding and comes highly recommended.

ftGe9g9SLyEiP9RnJ7Oebg.text: Great coffee and breakfast/brunch joint located just around the corner from Old Street tube. Ozone specializes in top-quality coffee with in-house roasting and a variety of select beans available for consumption on premises or to take home for your own brewing pleasure. The cafe-roastery-restaurant is housed in a large converted industrial space, with some nice bench and window (i.e. People watching) spaces upstarts, and a larger, albeit a little more cellar-like  space downstairs. Coffees are prepared in the classic Italian way as well as filtered and new-fangled methods such as "aeropress". The food here is fantastic as well, again this place is all about quality ingredients and attention to detail (a favorite of mine is the Buford brown poached eggs on sourdough with a side of avocado and cardamom). Perhaps a little bit pretentious, but it's London. It ain't cheap but as is often the case in this town, you get what you pay for!

QntphLL0LjtsaIpwXj2ofw.text: I love the atmosphere in this lively restaurant and cafe. It is located off the main road, marked by "COFFEE" written on the brick wall. Don't be dismayed if lines are long. Get yourself a warm espresso or latte while you're in line. The menu features exquisite brunch and breakfast foods to get your day off to the right start. I recommend you sit at the bar to watch the cooks prepare the food right in front of you with fresh quality ingredients. The serving staff are attentive and nice. Definitely a great spot to check out when you are in London.

dHDcoIS37Pzca0-0mNYAmg.text: Holy jesus the soft brew Ethiopian is a magical experience. It's expensive, takes a while to brew and is gone annoyingly fast, but wowsers. You can't call yourself a coffee snob if you don't try it at least once.Ozone is my favorite space to work. There's oodles of space, free wifi, amazing coffee and really good scrambled eggs.Real estate is tight at lunch when they get slammed from all the nearby office buildings, so you may need to keep your drink orders flowing to avoid a downgrade in seat location or a knowing glare to, you know, move on.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Coffee roasting!
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. View from the back bar stools
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Cold brew Ethiopian

wUOtWZuG9mzeN8uF8esC4w.text: A super neat space, with lots of brick and reclaimed wood, and a wonderful open staircase to a downstairs area where they do their roastin'.  They got all your coffee favorites: Espressos, lattes, flat whites, mochas.  They do not do American-style drip coffee, but hey, Europe's just weird about that! :)When I was there, you could choose between 3 different coffee roasts.  I think I chose the Ethiopian, made into a latte.  It was a bit tart.  But overall, I had an enjoyable experience, and I'd probably come back if I'm ever in east London again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

24x2FECPkwkViCcoGacO9g.text: London you never failed me...Superb service from this cafe... Google map brought me directly to this cafe...6 minutes walk....The poached eggs was perfectly done amazing..I set right in front of the open kitchen and saw all the action by their chefs  Great team work ! Hats off to this 3 chefs ! They cook with passion.... Every meal in the menu is cooked so carefully and fast...They talk to each another ask for suggestions n work as a team to deliver ! I wanted to leave in an hour but stayed longer... British accent is to die for  Charming 3 chefs and the food is to die for as well...

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

CU4HWmjiAi4r2UtAvsSpmA.text: Beautiful industrial hipster coffee shop with delicious and creative pastries and food. An amazing place to grab breakfast or brunch. I was really surprised how beautiful the presentation of the food is here.

hLkk-RXffnxbofitpmLuAg.text: I recently moved to this area for work and my friend recommended this place for lunch. Such a wonderful restaurant! The decor is lovely with wooden finishes and cute milk bottles for water. The staff are really friendly and I got a seat by the window because it was sunny. My friend and I ordered the portobello mushroom on sourdough and I got a skinny late and apple walnut cake to go. All, incredible, mouth-watering choices!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

FI94uNvRj9Rw5HQcYv5jMw.text: A very popular (and very busy) café in trendy Shoreditch. Lots of seating inside; warm industrial decor. Excellent soy latte, though served only in one size, which is way too small, if you ask a coffee enthusiast like myself. Order two and your fixed.

zmekxFV1fUzwGhh7oZdB_w.text: I had really high expectations from other reviews but their service was slow and my food was cold. We had the french toast, big brekkie, and rhubarb yogurt. Yoghurt was so good but the French toast and big brekkie were just a bit underwhelming. There are a lot of great brunch spots in London and if you're paying good money then it's no excuse for cold food or bad service. Coffee is outstanding but will look elsewhere for next food destination.

S0rC0iBS8Ca1QcUreXxHyg.text: OMG! I was looking at some old reviews on my favourite website while I noticed I never made a review of Ozone. HOW IS IT POSSIBLE!? Damn, yelp should really give you an advice, something like "hey you come here once in a week and you never wrote about this place, what's happening?!". Once a week (at least!) in fact, I came here for a coffee. Why? Easy:BEST COFFEE IN TOWN.Seriously. No even more, this is no coffee, this is liquid crack. It's perfect. You know when you meet your half? he guy/girl you say to yourself "hey, this is the one"? Well, apply this to coffee. That's what Ozone is. Your half, toasted and roasted.But it's not only the coffee, when I do really want to indulge myself, I come here for another dish: benedict eggs! Everything in the dish is perfect, the egg, the potatoes, the sauce. It's just incredible! Somebody else (silly people not understanding the value of benedict eggs :P) told me there are some other dishes too, but I'm sorry I'm not moving out from my perfect dish! It's just as good as it gets!You know in Italy they say "Visit Naples then you can die". Nope, that's wrong. Drink Ozone coffee and then you'd wish to live forever and have it over and over every day up to the end of time!!

6qwltigbaJpVbghBlB9mEA.text: Great little find near Old street. Coffee fiends, you will enjoy. Fans of eggs and avocado, this is your haven. Great spot to visit alone with your mac to work. Great breakfast selection ranging from healthy to wholesome. They also wholesale coffee which should inspire you to experiment with the options they have available. Friendly staff, the owners perch at the end of the bar, the chefs cook away in the open plan kitchen. Excellent chilled spot.

AYMRCauze5qbtnMohNGz7Q.text: As a kiwi I was excited about getting a good coffe & brunch and was severely underwhelmed. Coffee was luke warmFood was tasteless & quite a small portion considering the price - eggs bene with pork belly was a poor choice, should've stuck with trusty bacon!Service friendly but slow & very disorganised.Maybe we just went on a bad day as I've heard good things but based on my experience I definitely wouldn't recommend!

hN17KRD7Bn8G0keI-UcMaQ.text: Ozone Coffee Roaster - not the name of a place where you would expect fabulous food.. The Coffee is - as you might have guessed - amazing! Well.. never judge a book by its cover, because I was in for a surprise when visiting Ozone Coffee for an evening meal for the first time!The Restaurant is situated just off Old Street Roundabout and the first thing you will see is the open kitchen! The whole place is nicely decorated and would be perfect to go to with a group of friends, but also to bring a date!Their menu is seasonal and we were lucky enough to try their refreshing spring menu which is set up for sharing. Service was friendly and very fast throughout the evening!We ordered half a chicken, with sweet potatoes and shallots. And a side of pecan, parsley pepper, olives, and artichoke topped with a delicious emmental cheese and anchovy crumble! The chicken has a crispy garlicky skin and will just melt in your mouth! The sweet potato, topped with soft cheese and herbs (thyme and sage) were so flavourful and delicious I wish I could have eaten more!Luckily I managed to order a dessert (Madeleine with rhubarb compote) - a combination of sweet, sour and fruitiness, which was the perfect finish to a absolutely perfect meal!

roFq6mRB7HJm5t6KjT5HBg.text: Our first meal after arriving in London. Eggs Benedict with bubble and squeak was great. The eggs were cooked perfectly. My boyfriend didn't think his omelette was as good was fine.The one kink was the price. For 2 entrees and 3 coffees, $50 seemed steep.Darn you weak US dollar!

RgC41nOf0IGhsMr-fKKt3w.text: Beautiful light-filled space with spacious wood countertops and benches facing the window - aka perfect for spreading out and working with books, computer and wifi. Behind the coffee counter there's also lots of seating along countertops, looking either into the coffee area or down into the roasting area downstairs (more seating down there too!)I went on a Sunday morning just before lazy brunch time and the place was buzzing but not overly crowded (they've got plenty of space downstairs in a kind of cozy roasting area, surrounded by burlap bags), the service was really patient as I indecisively searched the menu. I ordered a coffee first and hung out with that for a good 30-40 minutes before deciding on food. For them it was all no worries and even after I'd finished by no means were they pushing me out (only wondering if I wanted more coffee to go with my productivity!)

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. baked eggs. underneath that golden layer of cheese are soft set eggs and housemade baked beans, yum

n-Df7D08JFiYXvK6B4MRUA.text: Ok so I went back to Ozone this morning and thought I'd update my review because I enjoyed my brunch a whole star more than the last time I reviewed. The major contributing factor towards the extra star was that we were seated at the counter upstairs directly in front of the chefs (we sat downstairs last time which felt a bit isolated). We really enjoyed seeing the chefs at work and our own food being made. We saw a few things we'd like to try that we wouldn't have ordered unless we'd seen the finished product. Coffee was good, lots of space, servers are attentive but not annoying and food was good. 4 out of 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Chefs at work
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs, side of avocado and a cappuccino sitting at the counter

spNzHoc17NJ1u1mMZ3uyRw.text: Let me preface this piece by stating that I don't review places. I have reviewed places and I'm clearly reviewing this one but, as a norm, reviewing ain't my ting. There are obviously exceptions to this rule. They occupy the finite extremes of my 40-something emotions and, as you've already seen my star rating, you know where Ozone sits. Ozone gives me the same feeling I get by putting on my favourite pair of jeans or slipping into a bath at the absolutely perfect temperature...it gives me a perceptible ahhhhhh moment every time I walk through the doors. I could witter on about the decor, the coffee, the service, or the food but that would spoil your 'first time'. What I will say is that I really like it and I hope you like it too.

eUeZbbFL9BmkbpDDUz34Ug.text: Oooooh yes - perfect spot for a healthy and delicious breakfast. I sat right next to the open kitchen watching the cook work his magic on every single dish that rolled over the counter for the waitresses to grab. A but pricey, but its literally an eye candy what they put on the table (see pictures). The only thing I have to grumble about is how they cook their egg benedicts - too hard inside. Maybe it's preference but I want my eggs benedict runny! Truth be told - I didn't request a runny egg but my friend did and yet she got one that was waxy inside. Fun fact about the staff: Overall extremely lovely and funny people that provide great customer service, except of one girl that rolled her eyes on us when my friend asked for a new runny egg. Probably had a bad day - we told her that it's no bueno, she appologised - all good. Will be back!

Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Egg Benedict with salmon and potato hash

J9eGrR4Jtyci8u50la6lDw.text: After a week of wandering the coffee shops of London, looking for one decent cup of coffee, I made a trip out to Ozone to get breakfast and try their reportedly delicious coffee.I wasn't disapointed. The breakfast was savory and delicious, and the coffee was fantastic!  The servers were helpful and seemed genuinely happy to be there---a big switch from the dour servers I'd encountered around the city. Being from Seattle, the land of specialty coffees, I know a thing or two about good roasts, and Ozone has some delicious beans. If you're not into watered down London coffee, head to Ozone for a lovely cup of coffee and their delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Delicious coffee!

PdvKrPa4GbS_d-J75SC8ww.text: I only popped in here for a coffee, but the staff were SO friendly and helpful, and the coffee was delicious. Plus you automatically get a free glass of water, which is fab service. So thank you :)

1-lil5mXRpaarlupf9W7Cw.text: Exellent meal.  I NEVER order chicken breasts in restaurants because they inevitably come out dry, but I was strongly encouraged to try the chicken breast salad with squash, pumpkin seeds, spinach and it was GREAT!!!!  Very tender and juicy and the entire meal was a wonderful treat.  Not the cheapest lunch at £12, but it is good value and I would always feel comfortable meeting a friend there.

Av4w7faW8CE6qYPIV2hCrQ.text: Love this place.  Free wifi.  Delicious brunch.  Good coffee.  And a chill, laid back atmosphere.  Great place to hang out and read or do work without being pressured to leave.  Not the most comfortable seats ever...but really good people :)

E6Oew6kFpNUyIFeecxICpQ.text: Nice local cafe. I was in the mood for a cappuccino and stumbled upon this place by accident. I am happy I did because of the great service I received inside. The coffee was also good and I may come again soon.

cjnIJEBo1LZE3V0DbxYuhw.text: During my ten day stay in London, I went back to this place three times. I loved it. The food was great and not to mention the good looking chefs in the open kitchen.  Very friendly staff and delicious coffee. I highly recommend this place.

68OnrSTcTYQ8voXArT5ung.text: I will preface this by saying that I like strong Coffee. Italian espresso, dark roasted beans that are oily and not charred. This place is the opposite. Extremely weak coffee. In fact I could see the bottom of my cup. When I asked for milk to try and give it a stronger taste, they said "no". That's right they said we don't serve milk with our coffee. My coffee here cost £4 and I can think of many better ways to spend it.

LYSUp-KfaUrEaFcna59HQQ.text: This place is sooooo good in all ways. Awesome food, service with a smile, and hip ambience. So far I've just had the salmon, poached egg avocado salad which was BOMB. I also hear the Eggs Benedict style and the omelettes are amazing. Also recommend the milkshakes and variety of fuit/veggie juices! Oh yeah, and their coffee is also fab. For a sit-down lunch meal, prices are average (£10 or so for most dishes).

n3HWpEneQ2IlU7VNz--V2A.text: Great coffee. These guys really know their stuff when it comes to the bean!

nlwB5aE-x6pMuOUIPPjHaw.text: Nice ambiance and food! They serve a very good revisited version of egg Benedict. Food was looking of good quality and very nicely served.Decoration is rustic and gives a warm feeling, a bit of a shame that street windows are blurred, I would have preferred to be able to see the street and receive more outside light, but just a question of taste I suppose.

pTO7nhlge9hXuMr9EyN09A.text: Have been to Ozone on 3 occasions, I didn't have a coffee but had a peppermint hot chocolate, that was extremely good. The eggs here are really fresh and always cooked to perfection. On one occasions they didn't have milkshakes (weird?) and no bubble and squeak cakes (which are amazing), so that was disappointing. But for brunch, this place is really good.

z3518oXxGa_Psnv3YUU7aQ.text: Met friends for brunch on the second weekend of opening and the place already has a great buzz. Its a vast expanse of a place, but has been designed sensitively, so that even on a quiet weekday afternoon, you'd find it feeling free of the floating tumbleweed. This is industrial chic done with verve and imagination  as opposed to minimalism for the sake of lack of ideas or cheapness, a common trait in London cafes. I asked for the baked eggs and halloumi, which sounded fantastic, but it wasn't to be, no halloumi  and I am but a husk of a man without halloumi. Sadface. Instead I ate delicious vege eggs benedict  with big juicy portabello mushrooms, perfect eggs and bubble-n-squeak instead of bread. Touch! The non-vege options looked good too, but meat is dead to me. We tried several coffees. The flat white was great, punchy and creamy, the espresso was good, but the 'soft brew' filters weren't to my taste at all. An Ethiopian Yirgacheffe and an El Salvadoran, both roasted dark with big roasty flavours that overwhelmed most of the nuances of what were probably excellent green beans. Oh well, pretty wicked overall.

2nZ0owQrOuH26hINhmZtVA.text: My friends and I had a lovely brunch at Ozone. Sitting at the counter was fun because you can watch them make all of the fancy coffee and delicious food. My flat white was delicious and the pina colada pancake was huge, dense and flavorful. My friend reported that the crab cakes were also delicious! This is a great little spot to catch up over a really great cup of coffee and nice food.

LiNGxLsoO9eQ7RwA41zuEA.text: Another cool hipster decor place. I came here for a nice salad and a tea. I just needed somewhere to sit and sip while sorting myself out underground wise and for our game plan for the rest of the day. Busy with lots of chill people. Super friendly customer service and ample seating inside.

ES-pasOa8isYmPRz3M3iJg.text: I've been coming to Ozone for years now and I have to say it always gets the double thumbs up from me. I live in Manchester but considering a couple of years ago I used to live/work 3-4 days a week in Shoreditch it was regularly on my list to hit! I was back in town after a long sabbatical last week and things haven't changed a bit, a lovely chilled environment - busy as hell but still feeling comfortable, with me even bumping into a couple of friends I hadn't seen for ages. It really has got that 'Cheers' everyone knows your name feel!Coffee is excellent (I drink their Hudson blend up here at Federal in Manchester) and their cakes and snacks are fantastic. I also hear their open in the evenings now for dinner - I really must get here in the evening soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Very tasty blueberry porridge with "hokey pokey" honeycomb

enZSMfAIOQt_C4o4CZy2AQ.text: We had gotten into a bit of a breakfast rut...so I'm laying in bed, basking in the early fall air, wanting some breakfast and feeling burned out on everything in our rotation. ::::lightbulb flashes:::: Me: ooooooo, baked eggs at Ozone. Husband: have you been there? Me: No, not for the eggs. Husband: Then how do you know they are good? Me: Grant T said they are really great. Husband: You are using last name initials...Me: Yelpers are always right. Husband: Fair enough. So we wander over to Ozone around 10am on Saturday, are quickly seated at the bar overlooking the (extremely efficient and tactile) cooks and kitchen. Already things are going well. Americanos appear. Even better. I order the (of course!) Baked Eggs with beans and cheese, which is accompanied by a thick slice of sourdough. Next time I'd even add a few strips of streaky bacon or sausage as a side. Once doubtful husband dove into a platter of eggs, beans, toast and a side of beans. I'd add avocado next time too, they looked super fresh and add a bit of ruffage to the mix. Both plates totally devoured. One important note: NO alterations or substitutions. They mean it. IT's cool though it means they churn out that food like nobody's business and no one gets confused. If you don't like something, pawn it off on your partners and you can customize through some added side dishes, of which there are plenty. The coffee is outstanding, roasted onsite. I dare you to find fault with an Ozone coffee -- I even stopped back on Sunday for a to-go cup after giving Salvation Jane a whirl (see, I am getting out of this rut, I tell ya). The feel is very industrial, clean, but somehow...warm. Very cool, but comfortable. The vibe is relaxed, the staff was on point during our visit, and people really seemed to enjoy the food and coffee. For under 30 quid we had two huge breakfasts, coffees and left feeling darn good about our newest recruit to the weekend circuit.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino

pJ0LfhOTm0X-L5RTC29-cQ.text: Had an absolutely fantastic brunch here yesterday! Sitting at the counter offered a great front row seat to the central open kitchen, though made it incredibly tough to make a decision on what to order as all the dishes looked incredible!!I eventually settled on the big brekkie- and big it is!! Perfectly poached eggs atop multi grain toast, served with crispy (American style!) bacon, sausage, a potato stack (sort of like a less creamy dauphinoise) with seaweed, and a fresh pico de gallo - fresh ripe tomatoes with shallots and chills. Delicious!! Everything was cooked to perfection, and you can really taste the high quality in all the ingredients. Topping off a perfect fry up, was a delectable almond milk latte, brewed from coffee beans roasted in the basement! Staff was super friendly and despite arriving mid day on a Saturday we were seated right away. Place has a great vibe, and lots of amazing dishes on offer- can't wait for my return visit!

pd0YQcze-VOdfuLYT6ZQiQ.text: LOVED IT! The best food, incredible coffee, friendly waitresses, and perhaps the most photogenic (Instagram) decor I've ever seen!! Great place to work, as the wifi is free and they have large counters next to large windows (I like sunlight when I'm working). Also good for brunch.

rf1e531IGtWlwf1HSvh4cg.text: Great coffee and Great Food. Great stop for foodlovers. At breakfast and lunch time this place is pretty packed so   be aware of a little waiting queue.

6LdHAvGKLStvy0_8xL6LTg.text: The food was good. But if you want to enjoy brunch it's better to arrive early like before 10am because there is always a queue after that

jA_V5dRDTfAJo1DsFuSx3Q.text: Wow !  Why I didn't come before !!!Great Flat white !! It's PERFECT. Beautiful spacious space with brick walls , big windows.Lots of seating , great atmosphere !!! Downstairs they roast their own coffee !Staff very nice ... I will be back when I need kaffeine in the morning !

Tuv04764Bo8mdsjun4MXdQ.text: Loved. Really quality, well made coffee and breakfast (toast and eggs) to go along with it. The space is really beautiful, with lots of natural light and seating. They also play good music and have free wifi. We went to a lot of coffee shops while we were in London. Many of them were good. This was my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs on toast and a flat white

tvN_UV3QNP2G_Cg5oqVuuw.text: We went there with high expectations since it is one of the best rated brunch places in London on yelp. Nevertheless, we were breathtaken by the eggs benedict (a must!) and the really the lovely interior. Last but not least, the staff was very friendly and food got served fast.Only drawback might be the rather high prices; but being in London, it may also be difficult to find something cheaper for the same quality. Therefore, we went again the other day and enjoyed another top brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

MCRm3iw_64Gz96_OoqTeGg.text: We stayed in a warehouse apartment in Shoreditch and found that this spot was quite nearby. Convenience led us to try it twice. We enjoyed a relaxing and tourist-friendly lunch in this local spot. Our espresso and cappuccino were spot on. I also popped by for a double espresso to go one morning and that was again perfectly made and quite tasty. I'm sure there is a Starbucks nearby but honestly, why go there when you can come here, have a proper coffee, without beans roasted to beyond well done!As for the meal, it was nicely presented but slightly lacking. I'm clearly not an expert on chips but these were a bit bland and perhaps under-cooked. Our salads were quite tasty and we'd eat here again, if we are in the area.

4V_UvYgZ2a3T3B_INKdCCQ.text: I LOVED BRUNCH HERE. First off the place itself is really cool, great vibe. I liked the bags of coffee that were hanging around downstairs. They have a take-out area for pastries/coffee or you can eat in. The open kitchen concept was also something I liked as it was fun to see how quickly they are working to prepare the meals.The service was quick and friendly. 1. Coffee- I had a cappuccino and it was excellent.2. Pancake- My boyfriend had this and I couldn't help feel jealous. It tasted just as good as it looked.3. Granola with banana yogurt- this was so so good. I tried making my own granola at home after this and it wasn't quite the same. When I go back this will definitely be one of my stops.

wKoWC7p9awaN51rPpF8Yfw.text: Was here last year on during a business trip. Wow, what a place. There's a coffee roasting facility downstairs which you can see and smell. The brunch here is amazing. I've only had Eggs Benedict once in my life and wasn't a fan, but this place made me do a 180 on that. Coffee is really flavorful and the ambiance and decor has that cozy industrial feel to it. Definitely will visit this place again when I'm in town again.

PK_FEljZ-mdmiW3I9yPxng.text: Popped in for coffee a few weeks ago and forgot to write a review.Ozone coffee is noisy, crowded, and didn't seem the perfect co-working space which I was on the look out for, despite its seemingly inconspicuous location just off Old Street. I decided to come to Ozone anyway, because the sound was partly down to the continuous roasting of coffee beans. Fresh coffee roasted on site? Good sign.I got a soya cappuccino and my partner got a soya flat white. We also shared a cinnamon raisin brioche. The coffee was beautiful, delicious and the soya milk didn't curdle. We weren't supposed to share the brioche, as my partner wasn't hungry, but he gave in; difficult not to given how amazing it smelled and tasted. It was on the pricey side for a breakfast place, but the coffee is top notch. Not a great place for a quiet conversation or working outside of the office, not cosy, but delicious coffee and baked goods. Maybe I will be back for brunch.

WE7ggeY379Wi0vKop1gXFw.text: Love the look inside this place. Got a flat white and sat on the wonderful benches for all of 15 mins but liked it a lot. Think it would be a gray place for meetings and working in. Will be back to sample food next time.

G4wqy4un6Iaq6G9stsgJVw.text: The marque is the center located open kitchen. Watch them make your breakfast. Coffee brewed to perfection with a great selection of bean roasts. Great menu choices, everything from simple farm fresh eggs , eggs benedict, portobello mushroom saute on sour dough......to Chia pudding and sweets. This place is totally hipster. There is a constant buzz of activity, patrons and chefs cooking. You can work on your computer at the counter that faces the windows looking out on the street. Or sit at a booth and enjoy the atmosphere.

l45AyE1i6NC8AfETMiIzYg.text: A lovely place to go for breakfast or brunch. Their soy chai latte is amazing and a must try if you like chai tea. I had their eggs any style (I chose poached) on toasted seeded bread with herbed avocado on the side which, while simple, was very delicious. The decor is rustic and modern, and the lower basement serves as an additional section for seating, and where they package(?) their wholesale coffee. I absolutely loved the restroom as it continued the style of the entire coffee shop. Although it's not the cheapest place to go I am definitely coming back here!

uxXBDwbqmTHHCZF6Gvlwfw.text: I liked the atmosphere here... But the food? At least for what I ordered, not so much. I ordered the eggs benedict on bubble n squeak cakes, it kinda wasn't my thing. The dish tasted sour-ish, probably due to the hollandaise sauce. I didn't like the whole combination. Well, I probably just ordered the wrong dish since it's my first time trying it. it wasn't for me. So I'm probably biased. Seeing all the reviews which speaks highly of this place, I might give it another chance. I'll give 3 stars for now as I can't lie to myself but I might come again to try something else next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict on bubble n squeak cakes. Looked really good, but gotta say not really my thing.

MUQGM-0kPdCoqF1Bi1uy6w.text: Crowded during weekday lunch time, but still a nice place to visit with moderately pricey lunch menu, spacy atmosphere and open kitchen. Good place to chill. I ordered the omelette for 8.5 pounds and it was a great portion for lunch!

-5BB1VI5z-YyvvxfJY4Nvw.text: Great coffee! And the breakfast is unbelievably wonderful. Try the smoked haddock kedgeree. You won't be disappointed.

LEgr-JDRQrQ8zZ02xtAH1w.text: A great spot for a solo traveler to enjoy breakfast before a long day! Great little one-seater window-facing bench for reading your morning paper over a delicious cup of coffee. With lots of breakfast options, it was hard to choose! I went for the smoked fish and poached egg dish and was delighted by the exciting flavors and beautiful, healthy-yolk color. A bit on the pricier side so consider this a "treat yourself" mean but they had some smaller breakfast plates to choose from as well. Would love to bring others here for a meal in the future.

xYLvS5vEqtXDM3JFq1fXKQ.text: Had the egs benedict and wagyu mince with a poached egg, an apple + mint lemonade and a slowdrip coffee and have to say that this was by far the best breakfast/brunch I have ever had. Delicious and great service. There was a line outside, but well worth the wait (just 20 min)! Can't recommend this place enough.

vG0-mSjpxj5VWFT9KoQatw.text: It is absurd, borderline ABSURD, that I have yet to review Ozone. *after consideration*IT'S STRAIGHT-UP CROSS-THE-LINE (NO BORDER!) ABSURD THAT I HAVE YET TO COMMENT ON OZONE.I like their style, I like their coffee, I like their food. Are we done here?Jkjkjkinda. I'll expand.Tucked away down Leonard Street, Ozone doesn't look like much from the street (unless you take a peek and see chic people working hard at the banquette along the window. That might tip you off). Walk inside, though, and it's set up similar to a bar. Like, a bar, bar. A drinking bar. Which works well. Takeaway orders at the bar, restaurant options seated around the bar, or at tables. Wholesale purchases down in the basement. Done and done and done; all needs covered.The staff KNOWS THEIR COFFEE STUFF. I usually go for the flat white: it's strong, and creamy, and delicious. It's a pricier flat white for London - 2.90 - but it's a cost I'm happy to absorb.The food here is *not* an afterthought. Think savoury scones (hint to the coffee shops of the world: more savoury baked goods, please! LOVE them), some gluten free options (grand), and little twists on classics. A banana bread with fermented pineapple, for example. A sausage roll with pork and peach. I like, I like.I've always just gone for the grab-and-go option, and not had a sit-down, but I think that should change. Soon.Yelp note: summertime? Ozone does a killer range of iced coffee options.

M7h5CqDk7fM-eT01apwJ5g.text: Ooh the coffee here was absolutely delicious. The food's very good too, and although my boomer parents did have fun making fun of some of the wording they agreed it was great.

-yotRuvgYSmNtzXE4Uw5mA.text: It was on my bookmark for London cafes and When I finally made it to london I went there my sister for a breakfast. It was Saturday, they opened at 9 am and the service was smooth although it looked kindda packed. I really liked its interior design very industrial and cool and they have open kitchen in the middle where you can see the chief cooking. Food was delicious and very well presented. My favourite of all we ordered was the apple tart pancake with goat cheese it was fantastic, i never had such pancake and of course coffee was great too. Another great thing about this cafe, you can see their coffee roasting machines working from the top and smell is amazing.

USTaMUSJV1jc3Tq7wAIQvA.text: Review for Coffee (not food):Good service, lovely coffee, though over priced. The atmosphere is laid back, and the interior of the shop itself is warming. There was a pretty long queue at about noon on the Saturday I visited so I'd suggest to arrive early to avoid disappointment and guarantee a table.

ohnVYlQ2bEaphCu8vCFnfg.text: Its a really funky place. Good customer service although the place is really busy most of the time. Came here with my partner and ordered from their brunch menu: big brekkie and the Cornish cakes. absolutely love their well cooked food and enjoyed my experience here. one of the waitress was really friendly as she always look out for us and refill our cups with tap water.Definitely would recommend this place to friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Big brekkie and the crab cornish cakes with americano and orange juice

Z9HtItK1r8yn6ZRN1armvA.text: Great food, the omelette is superb. Finally a coffe spot where the coffe is actually good. The place is very nice and so is the staff.

1Js0C771WIHK43WZyvG_oA.text: Best coffee ever! The oat latte is trully amazing. I love their food, it is very tasty and it reminds me of San Francisco, but better. You shouldnt miss this place, if you're in London!

F-6WNx_9xPFbz6Wyl4I59A.text: Ozone was my go-to place for brunch of coffee when I was in London only as a tourist, but now that I am a local well... It's still my go-to place for brunch, coffee, but now also for lunch, afterwork drinks, dinner...It's the place I take my friends or family to when they visit me in London, and usually they ask to go again!Coffee is very good (One of the best you can get in the neighbourhood), pastries are good, brunch and lunch dishes are amazing.They recently began to do drinks/dinner openings too, and at those time the place is decently quiet and becomes the perfect place for a quiet afterwork hangout.

DLIp5HgsyOnlqA7vh8rjHA.text: Possibly the best cappuccino I've ever had. Rich, complex flavor and perfect milk balance.

str1vXJJyZKpqGCZA6GeEw.text: 5 stars for coffee, 2 stars for food. Been here twice now and it's definitive that they need to fix the food here. It has a lot of potential given the beautiful space and excellent coffee.I had the toasted fruit bread with butter and jam. The bread itself was underwhelming, not that hot, and the butter is hard as a brick. It doesn't make for an enjoyable toast experience.I also had the omelette. I expected it to have the capsicum inside the eggs, but it was more like an onion omelette and there was so much oil! It was just flavorless and not nice.The coffee though is the saving grace. Well made and presented. Coupled with pretty good service, makes this place worth visiting.

Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful cafe space

IxHjoQzbobRm08bocRTHpg.text: Well - I've been here a week and a half and eaten here 4 times, and I'm a notoriously picky eater, so that should say something. Seriously, how misleading that this place is classified a cafe and has no menu or indication of the bustling restaurant on the website? Because I don't do coffee and NEVER would have come across it were it not for my more enlightened friends. Which would be a tragedy as the food here is FANTASTIC - very innovative, varied, a little fancy, definitely very hipster in keeping with the Shoreditch vibe, and they keep a seasonal menu. I MEAN SERIOUSLY IF YOU EAT IN ONE PLACE IN LONDON, THIS SHOULD BE IT. The kitchen is in the middle of the restaurant and provides a lovely view of watching the magic at work - you can see that they run a tight ship, and the food shows the care and quality that goes into choosing the menu items and ingredients. They've got that too-cool thing going - no need to advertise, no flashy sign [I'd miss it if it wasn't on my warpath] and yet it's packed inside. I've loved the smoked cauliflower & freekeh salad, beetroot risotto, bubble & squeak potato cakes/eggs benny, fry bread, pancake [with smoked custard], fenugreek and kasundi tortilla .... harissa mushrooms, chili butter cornbread ...I haven't had anything I haven't raved about yet! This is a restaurant I genuinely love supporting. JUST GO NOW K?

c4eQ5FhauvBwJlgvDTC5xQ.text: The eggs Benedict with salmon was amazing! Also had a very good flat white oat milk coffee.

sXyhnQDjfgm2hjCabG6cFA.text: It has been a long time coming. Working up to Christmas and organising last minute holiday plans, I bring a new blog post for the new year. Brunch has to be one of my favourite meals, and you know when you visit a cafe, you are looking for that meal that just hits the spot.I had been meaning to check out Ozone Coffee Roasters last year after seeing them at the London Coffee Festival and also being from NZ I am a bit bias as the company and cafe are NZ owners.The inside has a very chic industrial vibe with the kitchen open in the middle of the cafe. Your classic mushrooms on toast bring a something little different mixed with onions and topped with creme friache and emmental. I thought it was seasoned well and was a good portion size, I just wish the food came out a bit hotter. I think from watching the chefs serve up the food, the plates sit on the side for a tad too long whilst plating and heating up the plates could make a huge difference. My dining chum had a few more complaints however. He found the bubble and squeak overpowered the dish, and the pork cheek was a bit lost between that and the hollandaise sauce. However huge thumbs up for perfectly cooked eggs.Overall a few hits and misses, but would return again and would recommend it to fellow diners.RatingFood: 7/10Service: 8/10Value for Money: Good11 Leonard St, EC2A 4AQOpening Hours:Mon-Fri 730-9pmSat-Sun 9am-5pm
