Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

1W9vGHS0PSfOtSOkFnDZlg.text: Great place for a brunch date - an open, airy space set around a central kitchen station with a nice buzz from the steady flow of people coming in through the door - some with puppies, some with pushchairs, some for breakfast, some for a coffee with the morning papers. It's a relaxed atmosphere that makes you want to linger (much to the annoyance of the queue forming at the door no doubt!).I had the veggie breakfast, a last minute choice after spying the generous portion of the person sat next to me (always good to have a look around first!). It paid off, with poached eggs on sourdough accompanied by some nicely grilled halloumi and lovely flavours from mushrooms tossed with thyme and roasted tomatoes. My latte also hit the spot nicely. I felt a little rushed by our server at the end when she claimed not to know what cakes they had baked fresh that day - I don't think she expected me to wander around to the opposite side of the counter to find out for myself! But a slice of something lemony with two spoons rounded things off nicely :)On the pricey side then, as brunch venues in this area continue to push the boundaries of what they can charge for eggs on toast. But a good choice when you feel like a treat!

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. L-ahhh-tte time ;)

kkzkVWxFxsNlVRwpNXyxKA.text: A good friend recommended this coffee roasters and restaurant and it did not disappoint! The quality and taste of food is simply amazing!! You can tell from the first bite that everything is made fresh from scratch! We were there for brunch, we had the eggs benedict on bubble and squeak and the pork belly bun. To die for!! All served in a very friendly and hipster ambience. Definitely a place to go back to!!

0PdNtuQjqL1Klwnc-XvDEw.text: Great brunch place (also does dinners) near Old Street. They have a huge coffee selection and different options on how its prepared.Their food menu is typical brunch food - eggs, toast, etc - tasted good, but nothing surprising about it other than the fact the food came out super quick.  We were sitting next to the open kitchen they have so it wasn't pre-prepared food or anything, the chefs were just very effective.Downstairs area is really unique with the coffee roasting machine and big bags of coffee being stored...nice quieter place to sit.Staff really friendly and helped find us a little nook for all the luggage we had (last stop until we headed out to LCY).  Definitely would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

bttGYXfFjZ7v7UOF4JEe7A.text: Awesome coffee. Awesome atmosphere.Sleek Industrial look; antipedian style cafe.One of the rare gems in London for Australian and NewZealand coffee snobs.

tEJNhk_qaK9lO1Fq_8Wnnw.text: We had our best meal in London in this place. Their coffee is too notch. Their food is absolutely delicious and prepared with knowledge of ingradiants. We go some specialty coffees that come with a description card. We got omelettes that were  some of the best we had. I one of the best poached eggs I ever had. It came on top of fried mashed potatoes. We got the granola that was spiced. We also got their juice that is freshly squeezed. We set downstairs and you can watch them grind the coffees in a huge machine. A gem of a place.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Amazing omelette
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Poached eggs on top of fried mashed potatoes

m6NUS-HM-kkgHT2nUvM3kw.text: This place was aweosme! It's not only a cafe but a coffee roasting place... a roastery? (Is that a thing!?) anyways it was cool to see the machines and all the bags of roasted coffee downstairs and the kitchen was in the centre of the upstairs area!We got breakfast there and it was fantastic! I had this Spanish tortilla thing with veggies and two poached eggs on top !

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

PdmNiWDiEMLYCSPZsmzqjg.text: Bloody marvellous! The mushrooms with poached egg on toast was simply divine. The coffee is great. The staff friendly. Only negative is the amount of time it takes for the coffee to arrive as they also have a takeaway station which impacts those sitting in. Worth a visit. We may be back for lunch

71ePJk21JYi0iYSFvyZANA.text: Hipster breakfasts are funnier, when you are over 50.The well-groomed bearded young man took my order for "An Americano, black; the farm fresh brown eggs folded gently and served on the toasted organic sourdough bread; and a side of your organic pork belly that has been sliced and fried to be light and crispy."He replied "classic," smiling and went off to get my order."Classic," I thought.I suppose he is right. All I ordered was scrambled eggs with toast and bacon with a black coffee.It was really quite a nice place. The encounter just made me chuckle. He was really quite nice.I'd certainly recommend the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

hhbh1G8CsPzVB_8xMBfziw.text: I absolutely love it here! To work, catch up with friends, grab coffee, puddings, brunch, all of the above! It has fantastic food and great staff!

TF9d_SoTKjD2R5T4TZOtHg.text: This place was really good. Food had a ton of flavor and was definitely original in a lot of their dishes. Highly recommend if you are looking for something different while visiting London.

CAYs5_A-HW1_v2MIwaMJgw.text: Unlike other places in London, this is every bit as delicious as I remember from 2012! I was not disappointed in 2017 and am in breakfast heaven every time I come here.Food is fresh, flavorful, and not-too-heavy. Great start to the day.

dANyoknSGn47Ou74YI_-GA.text: Delicious coffee! Good chia pudding (I think that's what I ended up getting). They also have a few warm breakfast options, which I would have definitely tried if I were there longer.But definitely next time!

k630tbf3IWEloV_ygeQwow.text: Loved the industrial chic deco, snazzy food visuals, cool warehouse vibes w working coffee roaster downstairs. I couldn't appreciate all the various smells wafting to and fro though. It wasn't just the roasting coffee..kitchen smells were not so pleasant. They do the presentation well but food itself was underwhelming. Coffee was just a-okay. Super slow service from getting seated to getting drinks even before out food order. There was one party of three in front of us for a late brunch around 3pm. We waited at least 20mins for a bar seat. Fun idea but poor execution.

CU6XOb5hs4Oz63Yph4esLA.text: We came in for coffee but later decided to indulge in some savoury bites as well. The industrial space gives this place quite a lofty charm. It's also interesting to find it in one of the alleyways of Old Street/Shoreditch area.Their take on Eggs Benedict was quite interesting. I picked bacon option as a devoted carnivore. Instead of English muffin, the eggs sit on top of breaded potato mash. Quite interesting and tasty indeed. They were poached near or at exact point of goodiness, so no complaint there. Yolks leisurely fill out the bacony base and then your stomach. This is what I like about eggs that way and this place did not disappointed me.Coffee is good, so we had a double. Latte is served in a glass instead of a cup which I guess is a thing in London as Costa is doing the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Spring porridge

JZSf841Dba5E9MRfJuGfAQ.text: Wow this place is really quite nice. Not pretentious at all . Charming open kitchen concept with the coffee roaster open to view and operating during brunch. The menu is well thought out and contains gluten free options. The food is very clean from a dietary standpoint and the prices are reasonable for the pleasant service and wonderful environment. This Coffee house drops off a card with your coffee describing the character of the brew you ordered. Excellent!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Roaster.
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Ozone basement. Very nice place.

wXAXw36Qk57ycFJBfhfP_w.text: This place was around the corner when I visited London. Wish it was around the corner where I live. Everything were outstanding! Great espresso, nice breakfast, tasty brunch and delicious dinner.... yes indeed i couldn't help myself and my taste buds from going back trying new things and load up on espresso again and again . The staff were so friendly and watching the cooks work hypnotizing. Easy to understand menu vegan, vegetarian and gluten free..... and meat...

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

jwvkGz2z4bTBw-VS8r_7gA.text: Return visit had some service issues, the core one was being given the wrong coffee (I specified Burundi with V60 and got the relatively much less aromatic Columbian with woodneck), particularly annoying since the waitress had recommended it, I accepted the recommendation and then she somehow ordered me something else. Also, we had the chance to discover that not all the food items are as great as the kedgeree or the rhubarb pancake: the tortilla was an oily mess of onions and overcooked steamed eggs (when they start crumbling a little) which took some effort to finish, and the halloumi was soggy instead of the crisp rubbery texture that can be so glorious.Still relatively happy and would return.

WLW2IBh1LdfUydf98VhB3A.text: The best place in London for breakfast and brunch. I would recommend this place if you are looking for the best quality coffee and not regular food.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

70Gddwo2NwSx4BGizSFkCA.text: 5 Stars in terms of food. Lovely presentation and amazing flavours. The only problem I had with this place was the extremely rude waitress who made us feel unwelcomed. We were queuing for a table and two of us decided to buy coffee elsewhere while waiting. It turns out we got a table quite fast so we got in and were told by waitress #1 we couldn't have coffee from a different establishment, which was very understandable. So we told her we were just going to tell our friends what to  order and we would step outside to finish drinking it. One minute later waitress/manager (I think, or someone on a power rush) comes to our table and says in an uncalled-for very rude way that what we were doing was absolutely not allowed. So I repeated that we were just ordering but she was extremely sour and rude throughout. Honestly if it weren't for the lovely waiter we had after, I'd considering not going back. It's a pity that wonderful food gets ruined by people who should not work in the sector.

qaTfJZj_KACXb1WRYQL1_w.text: Love this place!! Coffee is fantastic, from espresso-based drinks (Flat Whites, Long Blacks, etc.) to Aeropress and Chemex. Lots of different types of coffee beans to try from different parts of the world. Food is super-fresh and delicious. Staff are friendly, welcoming, and passionate about what they are doing. Lots of room to sit and work, people watch, and chat with friends.Definitely worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon pick-me-up!

sYdAMzOoJ15618FKojorvQ.text: The breakfast was soooooo gooood. The have amazing filtered coffee and espresso. My favorite place in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

wiNHQig0OHD1vk9mPjaZXw.text: I've been to Ozone twice now as it is a couple of short blocks from my office and the coffee and cappuccinos are delicious.  The second (and last) time though, I had a rude waitress - the one with the purple hair, nose ring, ear plugs and tattoos.  I asked for ketchup from purple hair girl but she never brought it.  I had the omelette and it was just weird and not in a good way.  It was kind of greasy and over cooked with a granola type crust on the outside covered in cheddar cheese - way more appetizing on the menu than the outcome!  If you go, stick with the coffee.

0jdum1FuQE9-eYuE_RFGvw.text: This place is certainly hyped up, but I have to say it lives up to it. Great coffee drinks. Well presented artisinal dishes. Highly recommended granola. Certainly there is a brunch focus and not at all lounge oriented by the looks of the cocktail portion of the menu. (read champagne cocktails, pims, bloody mary....etc). The only minus is that it can get crowded and require a wait, but its not terrible and the staff is friendly.

XabDZWziKEgao21H4gZ16g.text: I seriously have to update this rating. What is wrong with me? Never in my life have I experienced something quite like Ozone coffee. Since moving to London, it's been my quest to find amazing coffee. Maybe the first day I went I was just in my own world or not thinking straight. I don't know, but I'm about to fill this review with ridiculous imagery, so be prepared.Has coffee ever made you sad? I can't say that it has for me. Angry, yes, when the coffee is just terrible, and I wish that I could take back my coffee order and not have to be horrified with what I was currently drinking. But sad? No. I stopped by Ozone to get some beans to try at home, but since I was there, I wanted to take some with me as well. I ordered a cappuccino and got some Ethiopian beans to take home. The smell of the freshly ground beans was divine. I got my cappuccino, and I took a sip. Their coffee is heaven in a cup. I wish I knew the words to describe what it tastes like! The coffee is a mix of sweetness, bitterness, and nirvana all rolled into one. The milkiness of the foam just smooths out the whole drink.I took it with me and jumped on the Northern line to London Bridge. As I stood there drinking my cappuccino and smelling the grounds, I was in bliss. I realized as the Tube made its stops on the way to my station, that my cup was growing ever more empty with every sip. I started to get sad. The coffee still tasted amazing, even this close to the end of the cup. A few more sips, and it was finished. My sadness increased. I realized that I wanted more: More of this delicious nectar from Ozone coffee. However, all I could do was stand there and stare at the empty cup in one hand and sniff the divine smell of the grounds in the other.I made some of their coffee and took it to work. The non-espresso version of there coffee is just as good. I sit there in the morning enjoying every morsel of heaven that pours over my lips. As my cup slowly empties, the sadness starts to swell inside as I know that I will have to wait until tomorrow to enjoy it again. Ozone coffee is conveniently located right off of the Old Street station. If I'm traveling to London on weekdays, my train goes right through there, and it is insanely easy to hop off the Tube and stop in. Unfortunately, on the weekends, my train skips Old Street completely. Which means that it is a bit harder for me to get to on days when I actually go into central London. Ozone coffee is going to make my weekend trips a bit more inconvenient. Oh, they also serve food. The pastries look amazing, but I have yet to try them. Maybe next time.

G5QnxLkyjYun2Z9vffYcZg.text: Lemon SLICE!!!!It was delicious. The longer I live in the uk, the bigger a cake fanatic I am becoming. While my arteries are probably not loving this newfound indulgence, they will just have to deal. Crumbly, piecrust-like cake bottom with light, lemony frosting. Goes pretty well with their solid brew. This is the latest Kiwi coffee joint to hit Shoreditch (Allpress being the other I know of) and it is a trule unique space for the area in its size. Spacious and airy with plenty of seating and an impressive variety of foods and beverages (they also have Meantime Beer on tap and a full sit down restaurant for brunch/lunch). I have high hopes for this place and welcome them to my neighborhood! Check out their really awesome website for more info, brunch menus, and nice photos.

hbWT7FLUO41BQk432519Zw.text: It's like i died and wen't to coffee heaven. by far the best flat white in the city.this place is SO good that my friends from Stevenage come all the way down to EC2 just to get some.

IByuHFKNFBlJxiK7AleqIQ.text: One of my top choices for coffee in London, I first discovered Ozone when a Kiwi friend took me there.Ozone roast their own beans downstairs, and I think it's safe to say they are currently at the top of their game in this department. I would recommend them for coffee beans above any other brand in the city.Atmospherically the cafe is outstanding too. The space is massive (makes a nice change to have space to sit down and spread out) and the decor is very well thought out. It's a great place to be!

Nr0Zy41f3OIYwFvb_Xxjrw.text: Amazing soulful food, wholesome service and excellent coffee. Honestly it is one of the best places to dine alone or with company. Even if the company is bad, at least the great food makes up for it. Really enjoy a lovely brew of v60 with any of their beans, watching the cooks plate their food and watch the world go by. Great brilliant work guys, keep it up!

QTQhWMQlCTpSMLwNEfp81w.text: Down a back street, close to Old Street Station, Ozone Coffee provided very welcome relief from London's April showers today. The space is fantastic with an open kitchen and coffee counter at the centre and tables and bar seats around the edge. It feels more like something from New York than London. Downstairs you find not only more seating but also a giant coffee bean roaster which is used to make Ozone's own label coffee. As you would expect from a coffee roaster, the coffee hits the spot - both the Macchiatos and Lattes which we enjoyed were well made and appeared at our table almost as soon as they were ordered which was pretty impressive. The food was good as well. I opted for a bit of colonial comfort and ordered the Kedgeree. The fish was delightfully smokey and the poached egg was perfectly cooked (ie a liquid yolk but well cooked white).  The rest of the menu looked pretty interesting - plenty to explore on another occasion. Finally special mention needs to go to the toilet taps. They are (literally) bits of copper pipe (see the photo) which spout forth perfectly warm hand washing water. I have never seen their like before!

7X5ZZfEPfGoI7nB0Gn5j6g.text: Stopped by here for breakfast with a colleague. While waiting with a paper for my friend to arrive, enjoyed a hario style Ethiopia Harrar coffee. It was out of this world! Ended up buying a kilo of the coffee, despite the expense.For breakfast meal, had the smoked fish kedgeree w poached egg, fried shallots & salsa verde. This was undoubtedly the best breakfast I had while in the UK for 3 weeks!I truly wish the food and coffee I had in New Zealand while there for a month was as good as that at Ozone Coffee. How long till they open up a location in New York City?(My only complaint here is the cost, but you definitely get the quality for the extra money so its well worth it!)

1H9nXadXBMa4LRDrkRC2EQ.text: Wow this place started off great! Poached eggs looked fabulous. But it quickly had me longing for American style service - even though when there I often think they should leave me alone more. In the end the eggs were ok to good taste-wise. But the studiousness with which waitresses ignored me when i wanted a second coffee (they are sooooo small) had me ready to run for the door to see if they would wake up to chase me. Considering the place was barely a third full I expected better.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. The lovely eggs that had me expecting the best from this place which sadly disappointed on service.
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Nice flat white, if a bit small

5tseeivwwFf3J5TZDaQq7w.text: Food is very nice, coffee is OK I had a flat white, not as nice as some other places, a bit over roasted or scalded, but still nice. I need to try a Latte next time to comp-are as they generally suit my taste better.  The place itself looks great, lots of seating which mostly overlooks the kitchen so you can see the chefs hard at work, and a bit of exciting with the odd flambé  A great atmosphere, and quite a busy place. Staff are efficient and friendly.

2bzUR4WLOfGNMXxlB_MM6A.text: Since Ozone popped up around the corner from my office, I've been addicted. Cute, friendly and knowledgeable baristas? CheckDelicious coffee (and hot choccy)? checkLaid back aussie/kiwi vibe that I've grown to love? CheckHigh ceilings, interesting decor, ample seating? checkfree wifi? checkThese guys roast their beans on-site, as well, which is a nice touch. It's fantastic cafe, which goes into wine bar mode by night. Though a bit pricey, it's definitely worth it.

i1BLET_VB_zr827uDnzUVg.text: We made a trip here for breakfast before work, as we had seen the good reviews about the coffee and food.  I agree with the opinions published here about the coffee: it is up there with the best available in London.  I enjoyed my flat white and if we had not been in a hurry, I would have had another one.  The meals were also nice.  I enjoyed my french toast which was as good as any that I would get back in NZ.  It was a generously thick slice and went well with the berry compote, honey and marscapone.The restaurant was busy, but not so busy that service was slow.  I'm not sure what it would be like in the weekend, but we are probably going to make another visit to find out.  Recommended.

pz0tqYwnONp6xXucXZw4cA.text: While the cafe is easy to pass, and a bit intimidating to step into, I was pleasantly surprised that everything about this place is impeccable. I love that the beans are out to smell, with detailed explanations about where they are sourced. The baristas have informed recommendations. The pastries are tempestuously displayed, service is welcoming, succulents are perfectly potted, the lighting compliments, the woodwork comforts, and smell arouses-- I feel as though I'm in a gingerbread house for all the senses.I can't yet comment on the served meals, but I can't imagine it's far off. I've gotten mostly pour-overs, and a couple flat whites. All have been made with careful attention and come out well brewed.

6YbPQLY04Pvp09-yk_MKUw.text: I've had mixed experiences here.  The last time I was here, I had the bream special with potatoes and rosemary.  It was WAY too salty.  The time before that, the servers got the order wrong... so I had to eat something I didn't order (didn't have time to fix - lunch break).  Of course the coffee is always good, so that's why I gave it three stars.  If it was based solely on food... I'd probably give it 2.  Go for the coffee, stay for coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

zXu2J2fcAHppIMyUCb6sZQ.text: Never been enamoured with the service, the coffee doesn't really do it for me, a little overpriced and they close far too early. Baked eggs are nice though.

pIdwMHvv93giqUbiskJ4qQ.text: Love this place especially the coffee and genuine authenticity of the cafe. Service is so friendly and it has a great culture. My favourite is coming here for breakfast to start the day...

xsqWUSGcL_Yqt1StGpn-PQ.text: Wonderful coffee shop with a great variety in their menu - from soups and specials to desserts and excellent lattes. I was here for lunch the other day and I can say that both my friend and I had a wonderful time. The staff were lovely, attentive and helpful with all of our silly questions. Considering that I had a solid lunch under a tenner, I can't really say a bad thing about the place. The four stars are only four because there are a few aspects that need polishing but the guys are definitely on the right track and I wish them only success and great customers like me.

etXojeUxo06rGHPjvsZeCg.text: The Aussie invasion continues!  I like this place because there are lots of different space options.  I ended up at the counter space in front of the windows (which you can't see out of by the way).  It was difficult to figure out how to get service there and it was really busy at lunch so it was hard to get a menu and attention, but the server was very apologetic.  They serve all day breakfast which is good because the lunch menu is very limited and heavier than I was expecting.  My poached eggs on my benedict were poached to perfection and I liked the potato cake instead of bread underneath.  Coffee was very good too.It was a bit hard to capture their attention for the check, but again apologetic.  My only complaint is that it feels so much like St. Ali (which is now the coffee workshop).  Maybe lacks a bit of originality in that sense....

PhC4I3v5zYKIf9God2ybIQ.text: Food - top notchCoffee - the best in LondonSpace - superbService - mixed - can be good but normally they are often 'too cool for school' / trying so hard to be hip it comes across as unfriendly - you say hello and they unsmilingly ask you what you want.  i even complained about this to the owner who quickly got defensive and said she 'is good at hiring the best people' then exited the conversation as quickly as she couldBummer about the service because it could be so great.

ENm5_3RqbvBTVkaKKaAGnQ.text: My new favourite coffee shop.tucked off city road close to Old Street roundabout. Very good flat white and let's face it the coffee is what matters. Cakes and baguettes on display looked moreish. Lovely ambience  urban style done well. Probably what Shoreditch Grind would love to be if they had the space and budget. I see this as somewhere I will definitely be spending too many afternoons

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

D15gYRFHe5iXa70B8w0GqQ.text: The best breakfast we had in London. We ate at the bar, and had a great view of the cooks preparing our meals. The coffee was excellent as expected.

rFj-U08BkZlyszHI_fVltw.text: At first I thought this might be another terribly trendy local placeall decor no depth.but was pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff and delicious food.The decor is very NYC-Tribeca/Industrial-ish, which personally I love. No bright lights or pastels.this place is all wood and steel and gets down to the business of serving a great brunch. The first time I went here I had the omelette with red peppers and salmon. At the time I thought: Hm, £9.50 for an omelette without even a crust of toast, is this worth it? Oh yes it was  big, fluffy and full of flavour. The quality here is excellent. Today I ordered the eggs benedict with salmon which was divine.The chai latte had a nice depth of flavour and even looked lovely (see photo attached). Overall, recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom

5Aa1mSPA4LpKj6znGwxzxg.text: Popped in for a nice cup of coffee with a friend - enjoyed this buzzy, quirky venue. Great range of coffees and staff who are enthused about their products. Food looked yummy - I think a return visit will happen before long! A great place for a caffeine hit.

HwdzHfhs2hsQ9HBBgY4r8w.text: Quite nice looking place, hipster and 'cool'. Genuine coffee roasted in-house. Food wasn't up to much - for the price at least. General feel of the place kept up its score.

mxK23EBOPQbonQrikUHTNw.text: I first heard about this through Yelp's/Alex's bi-weekly email. I discovered it was on the way to work, so figured I'd check it out. I was greeted with a smile, and the coffee was really good tasting.Based on those two factors, I decided to keep coming back, and started ordering Dirty Chai's. Never had one? Let me illuminate you to it's loveliness: Chai is a delightful mix of spices and flavours; a chai latte adds a bit of silky smoothness; a shot of espresso (not expresso, failed baristas...) gives it that kick that coffee lovers love. After only my 3rd visit, they remembered my order! Now they know what I'm having the second I walk in, and I still get a smile.This place has stolen my caffeinated heart!

CCSnaAUFP9bbXAMC8WBYjg.text: I always thought Ozone is a weird name for a coffee place.  I mean, every time I hear the word, I immediately think of the group O-zone (...of Numa Numa fame), which is a bit annoying seeing as it comes up not infrequently in my research.The place itself has the rather in-vogue distressed ex-warehouse type look (which I'm sure cost a pretty penny to put up).  It's pretty spacious though, and I love the open kitchen in the middle back-to-back with the coffee bar.  My favourite seating place is at the bar just next to the stairs - it gives me perfect view of both the kitchen and coffee bar and is adequate for people watching. So, breaking down the rating here:i)  Coffee beans - 5*Ozone does fantastic single origin beans.  My recent favourite is the Ethopian Yirgacheffe which is a perfect balance between Peaberry-esque acidity and the darker choclatey notes.  They've drawn my business away from Monmouth and the coffee bar staff have been super helpful towards me whenever I've been there.ii) Coffee 4-4.5*I'm not a big fan of their house blend used for their espressos. The flavour is pleasant enough but seems to be lacking a little bit of depth.  The brewed coffee is great though (and, again, the coffee bar staff are very knowledgeable and helpful).iii)  Food 4*I love watching my food being cooked, it does add that extra something.  The menu is decent, several egg dishes, and an eclectic mix of various mains.  I've tried the omelette and the kedgeree here.  I love kedgeree, but this one was a bit different to what I'm used to.  Still tasty, mind.  The omelette was good, albeit overshadowed by the chips that I got.  I think their food needs a bit more salt overall, but I can't fault the quality of the food and the cooking.  I'm still more keen on the selection at Salvation Jane next door, but being able to watch the cooking and brewing is a big draw.iv) Service - WTF?Been here twice and the service has been haphazard both times.  One of the waitresses in particular made me feel sorry for existing...that is, if she even noticed that I was, in fact, a sentient being.  The other servers have been pleasant but quite slow and I've had to chase up my orders both times.  I dislike sycophant service, but being ignored is just unpleasant.Could be excellent if they sort themselves out.  The coffee beans are some of the best in London though.

KdO7VrzAClkdi3vkjv7XlA.text: I am joining the band wagon of team Ozone Coffee for good reasons. 1. Simple but delicious food that is presented nicely on your plate. I could not help but oogle on ther peoples plate around.2. The ambiance here is relax and laid back. The Wooden benches and big glass walls makes it perfect to people watch in a cold and rainy London weather. I also like the bar stools facing the main kitchen which makes the dining experience fun and unique. The space in ozone is plentiful and uncramped while the decor is somewhat urban-industrial.3. The noise level is moderate. They play chill music in the background but still able to have conversation with and enjoy the solid good food. This place is perfect and much better choice to meet up with friends and conduct business.4. Friendly customer service. Our server and the servers we saw here are all welcoming, nice and efficient.5. Wifi! For those visiting London and wanting to take their work at a cafe, this is it.Too bad my husband and I are not coffee drinkers but I heard that they serve excellent Ethiopian coffee here.Overall, great spot for breakfast, to chill, work or meetings. Check it out.

z8OIt8R_a946ZZ0NKqzeyQ.text: It was a sad day when this no longer became my morning coffee local. But I still have a lot of love for what the guys and girls at Ozone are doing.   Their coffee is probably in my top three of roasters in the country - high praise indeed. Even better is that it's made within the industrial, New York looking building they call their home just around the corner from Old Street tube.   This place can get busy, so if you're looking to eat here - which you should - try an early morning weekend trip or just after lunch on a week day. Honestly the breakfast selection is simple but inventive to keep it interesting & their selection of sandwiches and other lunch time picks are top notch without the pretension of some other coffee shops.

zHf8JCu5wVS0-hM4nfr1Dw.text: This has now become my favourite breakfast place in London. Every time I have a Latte I can't believe how good it is... My favourites so far are their eggs benedict (on bubble and squeak!!!! not bread), french toast: rustic and just sweet enough, kedgeree (on the spicy side but very tasty) and mushrooms on toast. All delicious. I love every single memeber of staff, especially the manager who goes to all lengths to get you the best seats available each time. I profess my undying love to you Ozone.

KwtpnarTu_4aPe5i5kk1yw.text: We read about this place prior to visiting London. We put it on our list and hoped we would make it there.  We barely made breakfast and I say that because toast and jam - I seem to recall - was listed on the menu as being served at certain times. Our servers brought me some anyway after we had our late brunch. Toast and AMAZING raspberry jam (which is what we always have at home but NOTHING like this) after a brunch and tea that almost left me in tears as it was.  I'm not a 'foodie.' But I do appreciate new experiences and a good meal. And honestly, I felt like weeping at the counter.  (Which was part of the experience by the way... watching people actually cook... Loved it!) Maybe I was hungover. Maybe I was sad I was leaving London soon. Or maybe it really was that great. I had also never appreciated tea for what it can be until my trip to London, and the way it was served at Ozone was all just part of the experience to this Texas gal. We have been searching for tea service like they had there so I can attempt to recreate it but Americans are far too simple for that apparently and we have so far found nothing even close.  Every where we ate on our trip was great but this is the one place I will look for again when we return.  And next time I'll take tissues with me.

_DGL1mFFWcLVS0aaMgUu0Q.text: Confession: I'm too much of a forgiving person. Really. I find it really difficult to hold a grudge and that's why after my initial glowing review of Ozone, I neglected to update my review despite abysmal service. I've even sent numerous people here with a recommendation that they won't regret it. Well, fool me once, twice, err... four or five times. Don't get me wrong, I still love the interior and at least half the menu. But the service, jeez, they could get old age pensioners to serve you faster. I've waited and waited for these gals to serve me, bring me food, drinks and take my money. But it never seems to get better. Service has slid down a slippery slope and I hope management takes notice before customers have to resort to serving themselves.

PtNL0_BHqxCvG_3y4Gr1nA.text: Went for a Sunday morning coffee and could only sit at the bar despite being the only customer in the shop and a toxic waitress aggressively tried to upsell me 4 times in less than an hour. I ended up buying two drinks and regret not contesting the service charge.

WdBM_JQULMdcuw0zeaEhyA.text: In the heart of London's Silicon Valley, good - rather, great coffee - is definitely not hard to find. Despite this, Ozone sets the benchmark for phenomenal coffee. Artisanal, fair trade coffee, roasted to perfection and brewed as per your method of choice is perfectly at home here. The beans keep changing with the passing seasons and one constantly discovers new flavours of awesomeness. They have a great sitting area - it does tend to get crowded during lunch hours, since everyone working in the area knows how good they really are. Their lunch, is equally good and for those in a rush, a lunchbox is a healthy, tasty option as well.Couldn't recommend this place more even if I tried - if you're around, grab a coffee and a quick bite.

2gL-3t36PP72H1aXkF3SPA.text: Great food, selected ingredients, ok price level for shoreditch but no professional service. Student-like service, easily overwhelmed and getting mixed up with orders during rush hours. My suggestion: avoid during weekends...

photos.caption: Photo of Ozone Coffee - London, United Kingdom. Kitchen view

eeBXa-1by4OwjZOHVvOqaw.text: One of my favourite places in London. Urban and cool space with a lot of knowledge about coffee and food. The menu is, of course, Aussie-inspired. Their baked eggs are the best, but so is much of their dishes.

f5wl628TKcP7z2hKS13A3g.text: Is it me unlucky or I felt today that got a little too much attention.Upon arrival advised that I will be waiting my partner for 40-50 minutes.Ordered Carafe of red (very nice red) and cheese (wasn't impressed with cheese btw)3 different waitresses approached me 4-5 times if I will be ordering something else.Felt like they expected me to order more or something, hence left as got a bit annoyed (that's a first time - got annoyed due to much attention :)) hence went to Jane Roe Kitchen, just few block down the old street and comfortably spent the rest of the evening.Seriously guys, sort this out.

ZT_790_0Z27unwXRK_XKSQ.text: I absolutely love this place and wish they had more places like this in London. Ozone is akin to something you'd find in the States - mostly likely in SF or NY. It's a pretty big cafe that serves amazing coffee with quality food and good service. I would say this place is a trendy coffee shop without all the pretension that usually goes along with it (if you're looking for that, just head up the street to Shoreditch Grind). This place is very laptop friendly - they will let you sit here for ages even if you haven't ordered food. The decor is very cool and industrial...something you'd expect to see given the area. Lastly, the prices here are reasonable. This is my favorite coffee shop in London and certainly in my top 5 ever.

e8qJ76oTLT2lZhSunKWUUw.text: The service is usually abrupt (every time!) but the food and drink makes up for it. Decor is industrial - think rough wood and metal, so don't expect to cosy up and relax, though the booths can be quite nice. But the braised eggs and mince dish with cheese and sourdough is the perfect lunch on a cold day, and their coffee is amazing.

5Zccg2qeSuzHnPhspSVqzg.text: I go here often. The coffee is great, always a new bean to try, and the food and vibe are excellent. My one complaint is that the manager is sour. As much as she tries to be friendly, it always seems like an act.

B8FIRDGN4mZ4ewE3sbbQYg.text: This is a usual spot for us now as it is very close by and offers some great breakfast. The last time we went, we had bar seat facing into the kitchen so we could watch all the chefs at work. It is crazy how many eggs they are poaching during peak times! We have yet to try their lunch itemsI tried the soup of the day and wasn't over the moon about it. No doubt we will keep coming for breakfast though!

OO1YEJG2fkxWQuLeJsB90A.text: 1. Lovely coffee2. Expansive antipodean brunch offerings3. Spacious and varied seating areas - upstairs looking out the window or cosying up in a booth, downstairs for big congregations4. Silicon Roundabout cool without the Shoreditch twatteryLet's just say it's everything you want your weekend brunch spot to be. You're bound to get a seat. You're bound to get good food. You're bound to get friendly, unpretentious service. And the damn good caffeine injection will brighten up the dreariest of London days.
